newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico stocks electronic trade data delayed again.
newsitem.headline: Mexico stocks electronic trade data delayed again.

text.p: The Mexican stock exchange said Wednesday that electronic trading data would be delayed beyond their target time of 1030 local time/1130 EDT/1530 GMT and that floor trading continued to be suspended.
Meanwhile, traders said they expected extremely scarce trading on Wednesday after demonstrators blocked the main entrances of the stock exchange building, disrupting normal operations.
"Another 15 minutes more because they are making adjustments to the (computer trading system)," a bolsa spokesman told Retuers.

Bolsa officials originally said electronic trade data would be released at 0930 local time/1030 EDT/1430 GMT, which would have been one hour beyond the normal opening bell. That target time has since been postponed twice.
Meanwhile, dealers said they were holding off from trading because of the chaos caused by the demonstration.

Many dealers went home or returned to their brokerage house offices upon seeing that student demonstrators and their parents blocked the main entrances. Riot police kept open a back door where a few bolsa officials and traders entered.
"The feeling here is that people pretty much have written the day off," said one trader in New York. "The market is just in disarray. The Dow is down 40 points and the Mexican ADRs aren't in synch."
In New York, Telmex ADRs were up 1/2 to 33-7/8 while Televisa ADRs were down 1/4 to 31-1/8.
The disruption came after the IPC index set an all-time high on Tuesday, closing at a record 3,401.79 points.
